DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the effect of various oral hygiene procedures on reduction of oral malodor.
DOC.brief_title: Oral Hygiene Procedures on Reduction of Oral Malodor
DOC.detailed_description: Thirty volunteers who matched with including criteria were divided randomly into two groups. Both groups were instructed to brush their teeth with a scrubbing method for the first one week. Then, each group received the different additional oral malodor reduction regimen- in addition to tooth brushing tongue cleaning in one group and chlorine dioxide (ClO2) mouthwash in another group for three consecutive weeks. After that, all the participants were instructed to practice all the three oral hygiene procedures (tooth brushing, mouth washing, tongue cleaning) the last one week. Total volatile sulfur compounds (VSCs) measured by breathtron, tongue coating, plaque score and bleeding on probing (BOP) were outcomes of this study.
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis of oral malodor At least 20 functional teeth No systemic diseases No severe dental diseases Habit of smoking and betel quid chewing Oral malodor by food and other craniofacial abnormalities Current use of any kind of mouthwash
